title: I won my promo matches, but didn't promote?

embed.description: rice bringer / Gold 2 90LP / 130W 117L Win Ratio 53% / Veigar - 90W 77L Win Ratio 54%, Annie - 24W 13L Win Ratio 65%, Teemo - 5W 3L Win Ratio 63%, Kennen - 4W 2L Win Ratio 67%, Nami - 2W 4L Win Ratio 33%

body:
**PROBLEM SOLVED, THANKS FOR THE HALP!**
If you have any dodges, this may happen to you as well.


I am **genuinely** upset with whatever the servers are doing, I just spent the whole day climbing to gold 1, and once I win my promos, it turns out it didn't register, and **sent me back to gold 2**? The promo matches started at the ziggs game, one loss, followed by an annie win, and a veigar win. 
But I guess I have an anti-gold 1 curse, and have to HOPEFULLY win 2 more games. Which probably won't happen since your servers are going to tilt me into losing.

replies.body:
Given that this sounded extremely weird, I went ahead and looked into your account.  From my investigation, it does seem like you were in your promotion series to Gold 1, but you queue dodged the 3rd game of the series, which counts as an auto-loss.  Since you lost one time before, it automatically kicked you out of the series.  It does look like you got back into your series afterwards though!  Best of luck in your climb! :D

I hope this helps alleviate some confusion.  If you have any other questions, don't hesitate to let me know!

Hi, I'll take this opportunity to poke you about dodging and promo series once again.

Dodging in a promo game is a triple punishment versus dodging a non-promo game:

* you get the standard 5 min wait penalty
* it counts for a full loss instead of just a 3 LP. I can barely understand this one for competitive integrity, it **could** indeed be abused.
* it completely "erase" your full promo series and you won't have a free win for your next one. This one is downright ridiculous.

I already talked with a Red (you?) about the last point a few weeks ago, and it is apparently intended, not just an oversight. Could you explain the reasoning of the team, if you won't reconsider this decision? Because it gives you **absolutely no advantage** to dodge a promo-series, even with free-win taken into account.

Nobody would dodge a full promo-series, without even trying to win, because you still get the free-win if you lose. **It is NOT "dodge for an easy free win next time" vs "play and potentially lose everything"**. And a free win is cool, but there is always a chance to win the first time without needing the free-win, and if you dodge for the free-win, it still doesn't guarantee you'll manage to reach promos a second time.

(As a side note, about the second point: the problem is certainly real, but I think the practical severity of it is overblown... But let's take only one fight at a time ;) )
Oh, I remember that now. It wasn't a dodge, but my client crashed... But either way it counts as a loss, I just wanted to be sure.

> [{quoted}](name=DeathBurs7,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=HJmIEyhg,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-05-10T12:51:38.335+0000)
>
> Hi, I'll take this opportunity to poke you about dodging and promo series once again.
> 
> Dodging in a promo game is a triple punishment versus dodging a non-promo game:
> 
> * you get the standard 5 min wait penalty
> * it counts for a full loss instead of just a 3 LP. I can barely understand this one for competitive integrity, it **could** indeed be abused.
> * it completely "erase" your full promo series and you won't have a free win for your next one. This one is downright ridiculous.

Wait... what? You'd rather lose 3 LP versus taking a loss? If you did that wouldn't it mean you lose both your promo series (since you need 100LP to be in a promo series) AND 3 LP, a much bigger loss then what you're complaining about?

And, frankly, I'm fine with your last issue. I'd rather you go through with playing 2 games to their loss then 1 to get the free win.

The 3 LP loss could be postponed until after the series. If you lose the series, your LP total is calculated with the LP value of the games you played, currently, and if you are at 0 LP and dodge a game, you can go to negative LP already. Nothing hard or really original here. 

My point is, the punishment for dodging a game in a series (full loss) is much harsher than outside a series (- 3 LP versus a typical game ~15-20 LP). I can understand why it's kinda needed, but adding the 3rd point on top of that is more than overkill.

And about the 3rd point, I don't even understand what you mean...
But consider the current situation. For instance, if you win 1, lose 1, dodge the 3rd, you won't have a free win next time. If you just lose 2, you'll get it. Why would someone with 1 win in their series shouldn't get the free-win the next time, but someone who just lost 2 games should?

> [{quoted}](name=DeathBurs7,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=HJmIEyhg,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-05-10T13:43:21.587+0000)
>
> The 3 LP loss could be postponed until after the series. If you lose the series, your LP total is calculated with the LP value of the games you played, currently, and if you are at 0 LP and dodge a game, you can go to negative LP already. Nothing hard or really original here. 
> 
> My point is, the punishment for dodging a game in a series (full loss) is much harsher than outside a series (- 3 LP versus a typical game ~15-20 LP). I can understand why it's kinda needed, but adding the 3rd point on top of that is more than overkill.

Okay, hypothetically let's say they do your first suggestion with they remove LP once the promos are done. What happens if you dodge 5 times in a day before finishing your promos? According to the wikia wiki, you lose 10LP for each dodge after the first each day, so you could end with -43LP. That sounds like an auto demotion to me. So. you win your series, and then automatically get demoted because your LP lost from dodging is now applied? That doesn't sound fun and sounds like a "hidden" penalty, since (atm) you can't see LP when you're in promos (since you're at 100). Also, your point about starting higher then 0 LP is also wrong. At least, the official FAQ doesn't mention this, nor does the wikia wiki.

> And about the 3rd point, I don't even understand what you mean...
> But consider the current situation. For instance, if you win 1, lose 1, dodge the 3rd, you won't have a free win next time. If you just lose 2, you'll get it. Why would someone with 1 win in their series shouldn't get the free-win the next time, but someone who just lost 2 games should?

But, here's the thing, why dodge the 3rd game in your example? You only hurt yourself. There are three scenarios that could happen, you play and win (resulting in a promotion), you play and lose (resulting in lost LP and trying to get to your promos again), or you dodge (resulting in lost LP and trying to get to your promos again). Even if you got the extra Promo Helper win in the latter, it still doesn't seem worth it. You just got a guaranteed loss, as opposed to playing it out and seeing how the match goes.

Honestly, I say that it should be in place because I want people to play out games. I tend to avoid surrendering most times, I hate having to dodge and avoid it like the plague, and I just want to have fun. That's why I want someone who went 0-2 or 1-2 in their last promos to get the bonus win, rather then someone who went 1-1, 1-0, 0-0, etc. with one or more dodges.


Ultimately though, Riot wants to discourage people from dodging, because honestly it leads to a bad experience for those involved. It also doesn't help that many people define trolling in Champ Select differently. I know I rarely encounter it, and other people who see the same stuff as me may say some things were trolling when I wouldn't. But that's a separate conversation all together.

We must have problems communicating with each other...

> Your stuff about dodging 5 times during a series

That's an unrealistic scenario, and if it did happen, the person would deserve the insta-demotion. Sure, it would look like a hidden penalty, but a small loss of clarity in an unlikely case is well worth an improve for the more common cases.

> Also, your point about starting higher then 0 LP is also wrong. At least, the official FAQ doesn't mention this, nor does the wikia wiki.

 I never said you start with higher than 0 LP...


______
**MORE IMPORTANTLY...**

I said many times that I don't like the 2nd point / that I think it's exaggerated but that **I DO UNDERSTAND** why it's needed. My problem is that the 3rd point on top of that is adding insult to injury and has no reason to exist at all, **because unlike the 2nd point it cannot be abused**.

> But, here's the thing, why dodge the 3rd game in your example? You only hurt yourself.

Because someone is toxic in the lobby and you don't want to have a bad game? Like, you know, for every other dodge ever? When you dodge, you always "hurt yourself", even outside of promos. But sometimes you just don't want to deal with sh-t, and you dodge. You can disagree, but that **is actually Riot stance**, and that's why the first dodge only has a small penalty... except when you are in promos.

So maybe **you** don't want people to dodge, but Riot has no problem with it. The 2nd point was added to protect the competitive integrity of Ranked, but the 3rd point should not have been put in place, it's not consistent with the rest of Riot policies...

It still baffles me that promos force you to play with toxic players or take the insta-loss and dodge. If you're in your promos or series, you want everything to go as well as possible. If someone is dodging in champ select, the penalty shouldn't be so severe.

And you don't know the worse part: if you dodge a game in a promo, it's an auto-loss for this promo, ok. But it also prevents you from gaining a free win for your next promo, should you fail the whole promo in the end.

So dodging in a promo game is a triple punishment versus dodging a non-promo game:

* you get the standard 5 min wait penalty
* it counts for a full loss instead of just a 3 LP. I can barely understand this one for competitive integrity.
* it completely "erase" your full promo series and you won't have a free win for your next one. This one is downright ridiculous and I already asked a Red to double-check if it was intended. Apparently it is.

If the punishment were less severe, players would do it a lot more often.  If players started doing it more often, trolls would figure out that they had a good target and troll harder in champ select, driving the dodge rate even higher.  

I figure maybe one in 15 ranked champ selects show me a player on my team that I'm pretty sure is going to be trouble.  If I dodged just those, and everyone else had the same policy, it'd be more likely to have a dodge in your group than not.  

It sucks, it really does, but I certainly value getting into a game quicker every time I queue up as much more important than a promotion series or two.  I don't play League for its intense champ select menu.

I guess you counted 1 in 15 chance to dodge times 10 players so 10 in 15 chances to fail the queue, but that calculation is wrong because the 1 in 15 chances are not independent for every players. Most players would dodge the same games as you, because they identified the same trolls as you.

In the end, assuming your 1 in 15 assessment is correct, and taking into account diverging opinions and the fact that there are 2 teams, maybe the fail rate would climb to something like 4 or 5 in 15, but never 10.
